title: About Me
text:
Hey there! I'm Michael Lopez, a Data Analyst with a foundation in both the non-profit sector and data analysis, with over four years of dedicated analysis experience alongside nearly a decade of  involvement in non-profit initiatives. A Miami native, I obtained my bachelor's degree at Florida International University, in Psychology and Anthropology. Before moving to Dallas, TX, where I to joined a research lab at the University of Texas at Dallas before subsequently enrolling in their Masters of Public Policy program.
        
    

My time in Dallas has allowed me to partner with non-profit organizations dedicated to impactful place-based initiatives. My role at the Child Poverty Action Lab has allowed me to leverage data in transformative ways, enhancing program capabilities within Dallas County and the City of Dallas through actionable insights and meaningful conversations with stakeholders. Through my proficiency in R, alongside a strong ability to create engaging tools and reports with Shiny and Quarto. Additionally, my grasp of SQL and various other analytical tools complements my skill set. What truly sets me apart is my adaptability, curiosity, and ability to simplify complex data for a diverse audience. These attributes have been instrumental in not just meeting the dynamic needs of projects, but also in fostering a culture of innovation and collaboration within my teams.
I dive into every project with an eye for analytical depth and imaginative solutions, motivated by a commitment to contribute to social good through the power of data. I’m keen to continue exploring how my unique blend of skills, experience, and personal interests can drive meaningful change and create lasting impacts.

Portfolio
Throughout this portfolio, you will find a collection of projects that were either created solely by myself or where I served as the lead analyst. The analyses were conducted primarily in R, leveraging a diverse range of data visualization and analysis techniques. The final products were generated using R Shiny or Quarto, ensuring a strong emphasis on reproducibility. Notably, projects labeled with the “External Developer” tag denote collaborations with external developers, where I spearheaded the data ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and led the analysis efforts. These projects highlight my expertise in combining analytical skills with a keen focus on reproducible workflows to deliver impactful insights.







    
      
      
    










Homestead Exemptions in Dallas County



Housing


Mapping Tool


R Shiny



This mapping tool allows users to explore the uptake of homestead exemptions for homeowners across Dallas County, and view metrics related to home exemption uptake for eligbile households.



Feb 23, 2024














Neighborhood Eviction Housing Profiles



Housing


Fact Sheet


R Shiny



A neighborhood fact sheet lookup tool that provides users with the ability to review idenfied housing and eviction metrics in neighborhoods across the City of Dallas.



Feb 9, 2024














Trust Her Clinic finder



Maternal Health


Mapping Tool


External Developer



This mapping tool allows users to explore the areas with the highest proportions of teen births across zip codes in Dallas County.



Jan 26, 2024














Exploring Teen Births in Dallas County Zip Codes



Maternal Health


Mapping Tool


R Shiny



This mapping tool allows users to explore the areas with the highest proportions of teen births across zip codes in Dallas County.



Jan 26, 2024














Exploring Poverty in Dallas



Organizational


Mapping Tool


R Shiny



This mapping tool allows users to explore the areas with the highest proportions of child poverty across the City of Dallas and pinpoint specific areas of the city with high need for relief.



Jan 12, 2024














Children Affected by Poverty



Organizational


Mapping Tool


R Shiny



This mapping tool allows users to define custom service areas based on administrative boundaries (census tracts or zctas) to calculate demograpgic and poverty related metrics within their custom service areas.



Jan 5, 2024














Neighborhood Safety Dashboard



Safety


Dashboard


R Shiny



A neighborhood centered dashboard using bcWorkshop neighborhoods where users can explore neighbohoods across the City of Dallas to learn about police incidents or 311 reports that have occurred.



Dec 8, 2023














CPAL Child Poverty Changes Report



Organizational


Web Report


Quarto



A web report collating a number of city wide metrics important to organizational goals across all Child Poverty Action Lab domain areas. Currently focused on metrics related to Child Poverty.



Dec 1, 2023














Dallas County Court Observation Report



Housing


Dashboard


Quarto



A web report visualizing eviction court case proceedings observed across Dallas County through efforts led by the Child Poverty Action Lab and aided by the SMU School of Law.



Dec 1, 2023














Community Displacement Tool



Well-Resourced Neighborhoods


Dashboard


R Shiny



Analysis conducted with the aid of the Charles Schwab Community Development and Investment Team in order to assess where the areas of highest risk for displacement of residents in Dallas County may be when viewed through the lens of property level…



Nov 1, 2023
